intro: Microtropis fokienensis, commonly known as the Fokien honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly serrated edge. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
